6.23.19  7:39 pm   How do I identify individual harmonies in a song if I don't the solo tracks?

Do I just have to have good ear?

Because sometimes instruments like guitar, keys, etc, can clash with the vocals and it can be hard to tell them apart.

     in the beginning you are gonna have to use brute force. just loop that moment. pick out as many notes as you can. see what that rhymes with / spells with. you will feel like you are coming up empty handed and confused on some things in the beginning, but after like 10 songs suddenly you will really start finding you are getting to know the neighborhood. then do a few more neighborhoods and by about the 50th neighborhood you will know your way around the whole city and then in a few years you will easily be a world traveler, maybe get a job as a flight attendant

6.22.19  11:21 pm   well, i gotta ask. what's going on that you haven't heard before / seem like mistakes in the Mario Bros. 2 Overworld? i presume it's in the first two lines of chords since the rest is pretty standard

     what really made my head explode upon a closer listen, there's 2 things actually. when the bass hits the F, F#, G, A thing, that's like the most cliche figure in the world and it's been in 1000s of songs (especially american 'jazz' popular sort of songs from the 1930s and 40s i suppose?) (and also many nintendo games) and the chords are F, Fdim, C/G, A7. it really blew my mind to hear that the A note on the Fdim chord actually had F natural harmonized under it. that was the worst offender. it just HAS to be F#. now, it's easy for me to sit here and complain, but i must admit, from experience, in some cases you may go in and make it what you think it's supposed to be and it just doesn't work. Sometimes you see these paradoxes where the bass will do it the twisty way and the melody will just completely ignore the twists and do it straight, and for some reason it just works fine that way when you breeze through it. it's one of the great mysteries of life. The other issue, which was a little bit less disturbing but yet still defied all norms of the 'genre', is the A7, which in every fiber of instinct feels like it was supposed to be A7, and the harmony note should have been C#, but in reality they used C. this is not nearly as big a 'crime' as the F and A notes over the F# bass, but yet still common sense and experience of the 'genre' still begs that to be A7, at that point in the song. It really makes you want to wonder if there is some technoligical restriction at play, preventing us from having any melody or harmony notes outside the plain C major scale set. but this is disproved if we take a look at the other section, on the D7 chord, we have F#s right in there. The only other thing i MIGHT be inclined to hypothesize is that the melody and harmony line were written and programmed before the bass was there? and it was planned to be less 'jazz' and more 1, 4, 5 triads. then when the bass came along there was somehow a decision to go more 'jazz' and yet the harmony was not changed to match the bass. This is unlikely and doesn't match nintendo's reputation for perfection especially in these types of genres, they usually absolutely nail this stuff. or again to restate my other theory it could simply be that upon trying the 'correct' 'twisty' harmonies there you would expect, it might have just not sounded right. one of the great mysteries of the universe, but sometimes that is the case. BUT, without constructing a sound-alike and testing for myself, my current hypothesis is that it does weaken the song at those moments to have the notes in there the way they currently are, and i do believe it would be stronger if those were sharped. but i am only about 85-90% sure, short of actually constructing a sound-alike and trying it at tempo and in context

6.22.19  10:23 pm   Do you have any advice about facing the truth about oneself and the world around them? Like how to even do it?

     step one, figure out what and where the truth is. step 2 focus directly on it. say it out loud, with a witness, if you have to

6.22.19  10:10 pm   Any thoughts on the weather?

     it changes so much it is almost predictable. i predict it is going to change

6.22.19  9:09 pm   would you rather completely lose your sense of time or your sanity? 

     that's the same thing

6.22.19  8:19 pm   hey there, everyone tells me to focus on something particular to continue my life and gain money etc. but i just cannot think of my life only focusing on somethinf too spesific. i know that instead of digging thousands of holes i should be digging one spesific deep hole, but whenever i face with something on internet or in real life i just become too addicted to it, even if it is something that has nothing to do with my hobbies. i was interested in writing and painting stuff but know i spend my whole day researching history and science. i feel like even though i have nothing to do with music, i can even produce music and become a great musician if i focus on creating music. idk what todo, what do you suggest?

     keep some sort of journal, and start working your way toward some kind of narrative that may thread them all together. after all, all these elements are things you desperately have liked at one time, so wouldn't it seem very triumphant if in your story they all managed to be woven together to save the day?

Can you post what your current schedule is (or ought to be), and rate its effectiveness on the pain scale?

6.22.19  5:12 pm   I like the way the bird says "hey, here's the mail" in "hi, im steve". Like there's just the slightest pause before he says "mail", like not steve had already asked him for so he was going to say "hey, here's this" or just "hey, here's the..." and just expected not steve to thank him before he finished his sentence, but then he didn't so he just had to retrieve the word "mail" from his memory since he hadn't expected to say it. I dunno if this is what you were going for but it's totally relatable for some reason, even if it's just a small thing like that.

     that is absolutely intentional, it seems to be a clear contrast from before, when the mail was delivered with huge confident fanfare

6.22.19  2:37 pm   How much of your music is based on real events/feelings/things in your life or in the world

     mostly feelings/thoughts/concepts

      and how much is just random stuff to fill the song out

     none. if the song isn't filled with meaning, end it now. that's my strategy

      or make a nice rhyme.

     i usually only like rhymes when the words sound a bit different

      I feel like every word in every one of your songs is so meticulously calculated

     it is

     and I refuse to believe that that's possible.

     i guess it comes down to whether or not you are willing to trust your feelings
